node.title: Christchurch school evacuated due to nearby gas leak
node.description: Hagley College in Christchurch has been evacuated due to a digger damaging an oxygen pipe near the school.
node.content:
["", "
A spokesperson for Fire and Emergency said Hagley College had been evacuated as a precaution. File photo Photo: RNZ / Samuel Rillstone
", "Hagley College in Christchurch has been evacuated due to a digger damaging an oxygen pipe near the school.", "Fire and Emergency (FENZ) said it initially received reports of smoke coming from a building about 10am, but this was then found to be gas coming from a damaged oxygen pipe.", "A cordon has been put up at the corner of St Asaph Street and Hagley Avenue, and police, FENZ, and council staff are on site.", "A spokesperson for FENZ said Hagley College, on Hagley Avenue was evacuated as a precaution.", "The spokesperson said the gas leak was understood to have been stopped, but the incident was ongoing."]
